name: Kaffibarinn - The Word That Screams Reykjavík Nightlife Since 1993
description: Kaffibarinn holds iconic status in Reykjavík nightlife as the word that screams 'Reykjavík Nightlife'—this reputation stems from 30+ years operating continuously since 1993, occupying cute little red house at Bergstaðastræti 1 in heart of downtown close to Laugavegur main nightlife street where compact bar district creates dense concentration of venues allowing easy movement between establishments that characterizes Icelandic late-night culture. The dual-personality operation functions as café during daytime serving coffee and offering happy hour beer prices that attract afternoon crowds seeking affordable drinks (Iceland's expensive alcohol makes happy hour essential for budget-conscious locals and visitors), then transforms into absolute rager at night where DJ nights, packed dance floors, and celebrity connections create electric atmosphere drawing lines of people waiting to enter on most nights, particularly crowded past 11:00 PM when Reykjavík nightlife truly ignites. The celebrity ties reference both Icelandic and international figures: the bar gained international attention through connections to Blur's Damon Albarn (who partially owned it briefly in 1990s) and served as iconic backdrop for Icelandic music scene during peak years when Reykjavík emerged as improbable creative capital producing internationally successful acts from country of 300,000—musicians, artists, and cultural figures made Kaffibarinn their unofficial headquarters, creating mythological status that persists decades later.
